data.title: Kyle Broflovski/Alter Egos
data.meta_description: This is a list of all of Kyle Broflovski's alter egos and other costumes. These are alter egos that have appeared in more than one episode. Main article: Human Kite Human Kite is Kyle Broflovski's superhero alter ego, first appearing in "Coon 2: Hindsight". Human Kite was seen first as a member...
data.text:
This is a list of all of Kyle Broflovski's alter egos and other costumes.

Main Alter Egos[]

These are alter egos that have appeared in more than one episode.

Human Kite[]

Main article: Human Kite

Human Kite is Kyle Broflovski's superhero alter ego, first appearing in "Coon 2: Hindsight".

Human Kite was seen first as a member of Coon and Friends. After The Coon attacked Mosquito and Mintberry Crunch, he, along with the rest of the group, decided to kick him out. He later works with Mysterion and the rest of the Coon and Friends to help the people in the Gulf of Mexico.

He appears again in "Franchise Prequel", where he helped the rest of the Coon and Friends stop Professor Chaos from spreading fake news on the Internet. When the group splits, Kyle chooses to remain in Coon and Friends.

Human Kite is also a playable character in South Park: The Fractured But Whole. He remains a member of Coon and Friends and rivals the Freedom Pals in making their own cinematic universe. He, along with the rest of the Coon and Friends, investigate the strange disappearance of the town's cats and later fights with The Coon and Mitch Conner.

Human Kite is also a playable card in South Park: Phone Destroyer. He is a 4-Cost Epic Ranged unit of the Superheroes theme. He is a flyer and his Charge skill makes all allies in a temporary area invincible.

Paladin Kyle[]

Paladin Kyle is an alter ego that appears in "The Return of the Fellowship of the Ring to the Two Towers".

Paladin Kyle, Grand Wizard Cartman, and Ranger Stan deliver a copy of The Lord of the Rings to Butters' house. Instead, they end up giving Butters a copy of Back Door Sluts 9, which causes him to become crazed. They are found by Randy and Sharon, who have realized they gave the boys the wrong DVD and ask them to bring it back to them. The boys decide to go on a quest to return the DVD to the Two Towers Video Store after realizing how much power it had over the adults and Butters. They are then chased by Butters, The 6th Graders, and their parents who all seek to obtain the DVD.

Paladin Kyle makes a return in the "Black Friday" trilogy with an updated design. He is a member of the group planning to get Xbox Ones on Black Friday. Stan leaves the group after deciding he wanted a Playstation 4, specifically upsetting Kyle, who makes the decision to remain with the Xbox army. The conflict ends with the boys deciding that would rather play with the Stick of Truth, with Stan and Kyle's friendship remaining intact.

High Jew Elf King[]

Main article: High Jew Elf King

High Jew Elf King, or Kyle of the Drow Elves in Phone Destroyer, is Kyle's fantasy alter ego which makes an appearance in South Park: The Stick of Truth and South Park: Phone Destroyer.

After the events of the "Black Friday" trilogy, Kyle becomes the leader of the Elven Kingdom in South Park: The Stick of Truth, abandoning his Paladin alter ego. His group rivals the Kingdom of Kupa Keep as they fight to obtain the Stick of Truth, with Ranger Stan as his second-in-command.

He attempts to convince the New Kid to join the Drow Elves, giving the player the option of joining his team or remaining with the Kingdom of Kupa Keep. When the humans and elves team up to take back the stick of truth from the out of control Clyde, Kyle is unlocked as a buddy which the New Kid can take into battle. Kyle is considered one of the most powerful buddies in the game since his abilities are very strong. Sadly, he is only able to be used on the last day of the game.

Kyle of the Drow Elves was inspired greatly by Kyle's Stick of Truth persona, like many other fantasy cards. Kyle's South Park: Phone Destroyer card is a 4-Cost Rare Ranged unit of the Fantasy theme, meaning he deals damage from far away and is able to hit flying characters. When Kyle's ability is fully charged, he spins in a circle with leaves flying around him and summons holographic bubbles around every ally on the field, granting them invincibility for 3 seconds.

Current No Hat Kyle[]

Current No Hat Kyle is Kyle's current hatless appearance which was first shown in "How to Eat with Your Butt".

He had a large, frizzy ginger afro which is usually concealed by his hat. Although his hair was hidden by his hat for the first five seasons, it has made more frequent appearances in later seasons. In "How to Eat with Your Butt", he is required by his teacher to take off his hat for picture day, which he does reluctantly.

His hair can be seen in "The Losing Edge" and "You're Getting Old", concealed slightly by a baseball cap and party hat respectively. Other notable appearances include in "Elementary School Musical", where his hair is seen in the style of Corbin Bleu, "Quest for Ratings" in an exaggerated anchorman coif, and "It's a Jersey Thing", when he transforms into a Jerseyite. It also is an optional hairstyle in South Park: The Fractured but Whole that the player can choose for their character, being referred to as “The Broflovski”.

Temporary No Hat Kyle[]

Temporary No Hat Kyle was first shown in "SUPER HARD PCness".

After being dumped by Heidi Turner and denouncing Terrance and Phillip, Kyle decides to make a change and shaves his hair shorter along with changing his shirt. Though he is pleased with this change, he ends up covering his hair back up with his hat anyway.

His new haircut has not been seen since "SUPER HARD PCness", though it can be assumed that it has not grown out yet. In Worldwide Privacy Tour His old haircut was seen again, meaning it has grown out and he does not have this haircut anymore.

Pajamas Kyle[]

Pajamas Kyle is an alter ego that has made several appearances since "A Very Crappy Christmas".

Kyle is occasionally seen wearing his pajamas at night. They are dark blue and features a print with the characters Terrance and Phillip. These pajamas are the same one that the player wears in South Park: The Stick of Truth.

Formal Kyle[]

Formal Kyle is an alter ego that first appears in "Quintuplets 2000".

His formal attire consists of a black blazer over a white dress shirt, black dress pants, and a red tie. This outfit can be seen with slight alterations in such episodes as "Casa Bonita", being worn to the aforementioned restaurant; "The Return of Chef", being worn at Chef's funeral; and at Clyde Frog's funeral in "1%".

Alter Egos From Season One[]

Chewbacca Kyle[]

Chewbacca Kyle is a Halloween costume that makes an appearance in "Pinkeye".

The costume is a store-bought Chewbacca mask that Kyle wears for the costume contest. Upon discovering that the rest of his class are also wearing Chewbacca masks, he decides to get another costume.

Solar System Kyle[]

Solar System Kyle is a Halloween costume that makes an appearance in "Pinkeye".

The costume consists of a large yellow sphere at the center acting as the sun connected to smaller models of the planet with wire. Kyle wears this costume for the contest but ultimately loses to Wendy Testaburger.

Vampire Kyle[]

Vampire Kyle is a Halloween costume that makes an appearance in "Pinkeye".

After going through two other costumes, Kyle settles on a vampire costume for trick-or-treating after the contest. It is made up of a black shirt with a red stripe, a cape and vampire teeth. He also wears a bronze medal with a yellow ribbon.

Joseph Kyle[]

Joseph Kyle is a costume Kyle wears in "Mr. Hankey, the Christmas Poo".

Kyle wears this costume when he plays Joseph of Arimathea in the school's nativity play. It consists of a brown robe over his normal clothes and a fake beard.

Straight Jacket Kyle[]

Straight Jacket Kyle is an alter ego that appears in "Mr. Hankey, the Christmas Poo".

Kyle starts to see what he believes are hallucinations of a being called Mr. Hankey, an anthropomorphic piece of feces. After an incident at the school involving Mr. Mackey, he is labeled a Fecophiliac, getting himself admitted into a mental hospital and put in a straight jacket.

Alter Egos From Season Two[]

Dr. Kyle[]

Dr. Kyle is an alter ego that makes an appearance in "Cartman's Mom is Still a Dirty Slut". His outfit consists of light blue scrubs and a white surgical mask.

Dodgeball Kyle[]

Dodgeball Kyle is an alter ego that makes an appearance in "Conjoined Fetus Lady".

Kyle and the rest of the boys are shown to be a part of the South Park Cows dodgeball team. The uniform consists of green jerseys with the South Park Cows insignia near the right sleeve. Their team ends up winning the State Competition in Denver, the Nationals in Washington D.C. and finally the World Championships in China.

Evil Kyle[]

Evil Kyle is an alternate universe alter ego that makes an appearance in "Spookyfish".

Evil Kyle is Kyle's evil doppelganger who came to South Park from an alternate universe via the portal that opened up at the Indian Burial Ground Pet Store. He shows up in order to bring Evil Cartman back to their universe. His appearance is identical to Kyle's, except that he has a brown goatee.

Alter Egos From Season Three[]

Getting Gay With Kids Kyle[]

Getting Gay With Kids Kyle is an alter ego that appears in "Rainforest Shmainforest".

This is the uniform Kyle wears when he is a part of the Getting Gay With Kids choir. It consists of a yellow long sleeve shirt with the group's acronym on it behind a pink music note, white gloves and dark blue jeans.

Jewbilee Kyle[]

Jewbilee Kyle is an alter ego that appears in the episodes "Two Guys Naked in a Hot Tub" and "Jewbilee".

In the episode, Kyle attends Jewbilee with Ike and Kenny, who lies about being Jewish in order to join the scouts during the meteor shower. Their uniform consists of a gray-green jacket with various badges and a yellow bandana scarf.

Clown Kyle[]

Clown Kyle is a Halloween costume that appears in "Korn's Groovy Pirate Ghost Mystery".

Kyle wears this costume to the Halloween Haunt at the beginning of the episode. It consists of clown face paint, a red wig, an oversized yellow jacket over his usual one and light blue pants.

Chinpokomon Soldier Kyle[]

Chinpokomon Solider Kyle is an alter ego that appears in "Chinpokomon".

Kyle, along with the rest of the children in South Park, gets sucked into the Chinpokomon fad and becomes a Japanese soldier. He wears the Chinpokomon Camp uniform: a brown jacket, matching pants, and a red bandana scarf.

Union Soldier Kyle[]

Union Soldier Kyle is an alter ego that appears in "The Red Badge of Gayness".

Kyle wears this outfit at the Civil War reenactment, where he makes a bet with Cartman that their side will beat the Confederates. It is modeled after the uniforms worn by the Union soldiers in the Civil War with a blue button-up jacket with a black belt, gray pants, and a blue hat.

Abraham Lincoln Kyle[]

Abraham Lincoln Kyle is an alter ego that appears in "The Red Badge of Gayness".

This costume is modeled after Abraham Lincoln and features his signature top hat, tuxedo, and a fake beard. Kyle dresses as Abraham Lincoln in order to put an end to the war and win Cartman's bet. However, this ends up backfiring, since his actions ended slavery, thus making it illegal for him and Stan to make Cartman their slave.

Period Kyle[]

Period Kyle is an alter ego that makes an appearance in "Are You There God? It's Me, Jesus".

Cartman and Kenny contract a virus that causes them to bleed out of their anus, leading them to believe they've started their period. In an attempt to fit in with them, Kyle lies and says that he has also started his period. When hanging out at their clubhouse, he wears this outfit, consisting of a red scarf tied around his head and a golden wing-shaped collar.

Alter Egos From Season Four[]

Tooth Trade Kyle[]

Tooth Trade Kyle is an alter ego that makes an appearance in "The Tooth Fairy Tats 2000".

After joining the tooth trade, hiding teeth under the pillows of rich kids, and collecting the money, the boys become wealthy. Kyle wears a suit similar to his formal outfit with a black blazer, a dress shirt, and black dress pants. After finding out that the tooth fairy is not real, he also carries around a book that he reads to try and find the meaning of life.

Dream Fingerbang Kyle[]

Dream Fingerbang Kyle is an alter ego that appears in "Something You Can Do with Your Finger".

When Cartman has a dream about being in a boy band, Kyle is seen as one of the members. His outfit consists of a green dress shirt, a white jacket, a white ushanka and a black earpiece microphone.

Fingerbang Kyle[]

Fingerbang Kyle is an alter ego that appears in "Something You Can Do with Your Finger".

After joining Fingerbang with the other boys, Kyle chooses to be the "bad boy." Their band only plays one show at the South Park Mall before they decide that the fame is too much for them. His costume consists of a fake mustache, a black leather jacket, a gold chain necklace and blue jeans.

Treasure Cove Kyle[]

Treasure Cove Kyle is an alter ego that makes an appearance in "The Wacky Molestation Adventure".

After getting all the adults arrested by claiming to have been "molestered" by them, the children of South Park split into two groups: SmileyTown, lead by Cartman, and Treasure Cove, led by Kyle and Stan. Kyle wears a beat-up, tattered costume with a brown cape, shoulder pads, and a scrap of fabric tied around his hat. His face is also covered in dirt and grime.

Coat Over Pajamas Kyle[]

Coat Over Pajamas Kyle is an alter ego that first makes an appearance in "A Very Crappy Christmas".

Kyle can be seen wearing this at night when he and the boys search for Mr. Hankey in the sewers. The outfit is similar to Pajamas Kyle, except that he wears his usual orange coat over his pajamas.

Alter Egos From Season Five[]

Blaintologist Kyle[]

Blaintologist Kyle is an alter ego that appears in "Super Best Friends".

Kyle and his friends discover a street magician named David Blaine performing on the streets of South Park. The boys, impressed by his feats, all decide to go to one of his "camps", which turns out to actually be a front for his cult. Stan tries to get Kyle to leave, though the latter refuses and they break off their friendship. He is eventually rescued by Stan and the Super Best Friends. The cult uniform consists of a white button-up dress shirt and blue pants.

STD Fighter Kyle[]

STD Fighter Kyle is an alter ego that appears in "Proper Condom Use".

Frightened by a sex education class taught by Ms. Choksondik, the boys and girls start a gender war mistakenly believing the other sex would give them STDs. During the battle, Kyle wears an outfit reminiscent of a green military uniform with an olive green long-sleeved shirt over a light brown shirt with pockets and a brown ammunition belt, army green gloves, brown pants and black boots.

Gas Mask Kyle[]

Gas Mask Kyle is an alter ego that makes an appearance in "Osama bin Laden Has Farty Pants".

Kyle, along with the rest of the boys, are seen wearing gas masks at the bus stop following the 9/11 terrorist attack. He wears a gas mask to prevent from catching the anthrax after the said terrorist attack.

Alter Egos From Season Six[]

Skier Kyle[]

Skier Kyle is an alter ego that makes an appearance in "Asspen".

After getting a free two-day trip to Aspen in exchange for attending a half-hour timeshare presentation, the boys' parents decide to take them all that weekend. Kyle wears this outfit while skiing with his little brother Ike and his friends. It consists of his usual attire, except with blue ski pants and a pair of skis.

"Keep Truckin'" Shirt Kyle[]

"Keep Truckin'" Shirt Kyle is an alter ego that appears in "Fun with Veal".

After The Boys steal a group of Baby Cows from Bill Denkins' farm upon discovering that veal is made from baby cows, they lock themselves and the Baby Cows in Stan's bedroom in order to protect the cows from being killed. Kyle can later be seen wearing a white shirt with the words "Keep Truckin'" written on it with an image of a red monster truck.

Simpsons Kyle[]

Simpsons Kyle is an alter ego that appears in "The Simpsons Already Did It".

Professor Chaos tries to create a diabolical plan to get back at the town of South Park; however, he becomes frustrated when he realizes all of his ideas have already been done on the show The Simpsons. He eventually starts hallucinating, seeing everyone as characters from The Simpsons, including Kyle. Here, he retains his regular outfit but is drawn in an art style parodying the aforementioned show.

Mongolian Kyle[]

Mongolian Kyle is an alter ego that appears in "Child Abduction is Not Funny".

The adults, after being frightened by stories on the news about child abduction, decide that the only way to keep their children safe is by leaving them alone in South Park. They end up taking refuge with the Mongolians who had been tearing down Tuong Lu Kim's wall throughout the episode. Kyle can be seen among the other children wearing a purple robe with a lighter purple trim over a brown tattered shirt with a yellow collar and navy blue jeans.

Alter Egos From Season Seven[]

Art Class Kyle[]

Art Class Kyle is an alter ego that makes an appearance in "Toilet Paper".

This outfit can be seen while the boys are in art class, where they are given detention for building an erect penis out of clay. This causes them to toilet paper the art teacher, Mrs. Streibel's house, a decision that Kyle later regrets. He wears a light blue robe covered with paint splatters.

Junior Detective Kyle[]

Junior Detective Kyle is an alter ego that makes an appearance in "Lil' Crime Stoppers".

The boys, pretending to be police detectives, return a missing doll to a little girl, leading the police department to name them Junior Detectives. This job ends up taking a large toll on the boys, as they are forced to put aside their schoolwork in order to do their jobs. Kyle wears an oversized brown button-up shirt with a Junior Detective badge.

Laundromat Kyle[]

Laundromat Kyle is an alter ego that makes an appearance in "Lil' Crime Stoppers".

After giving up their roles and junior detective jobs, the boys decide to play laundromat instead. Kyle wears a white button-up shirt, a blue vest, a name card, and a fake beard.

Metrosexual Kyle[]

Metrosexual Kyle is an alter ego that makes an appearance in "South Park is Gay!".

When Kyle briefly followed the metrosexual fad, the boys took him out to get a makeover where his hair is styled and his outfit changes into an orange button-up shirt, blue pants and a green flat cap. He quickly abandons this attire when he decides not to follow the fad any longer.

Beat Up Kyle[]

Beat Up Kyle is an alter ego that makes an appearance in "South Park is Gay!".

After abandoning the metrosexual fad, the boys kick him out of their gang and leave him to get beaten up by Craig's Gang for being too "butch."

Crab Person Kyle[]

Crab Person Kyle is an alter ego that makes an appearance in "South Park is Gay!".

Kyle, blaming the show "Queer Eye for the Straight Guy" for starting the metrosexual fad, decides to go to their headquarters to kill "The Fab Five" with Mr. Garrison. The Fab Five reveal themselves to be Crab People who are using the metrosexual fad to weaken the human race. The Crab People give Mr. Garrison and Kyle Crab People makeovers, mirroring the events of the beginning of the episode. His costume consists of fake crab eyestalks and antennas, the front of his jacket is painted red with a light red circular patch to represent an underbelly, red gloves that resemble crab pincers and red shoes

Moop Kyle[]

Moop Kyle is an alter ego that makes an appearance in "Christian Rock Hard".

"Moop" is the name of a band Kyle, Stan, Cartman, and Kenny started, in which Kyle was the bassist. After being abandoned by Cartman, who goes off to start a Christian rock band, the boys seek to make their band better. However, when they try to download music for inspiration, they are arrested and shown the consequences downloading music has on wealthy musicians. They attempt to start a movement against pirating music until they realize that all the time they spent protesting could have been spent making actual music.

Undercover "Black Person" Kyle[]

Undercover "Black Person" Kyle is an alter ego that makes an appearance in "Grey Dawn".

After the senior citizens of South Park take over the town, the boys try to disguise themselves as "black people" in order to scare them off, wearing all black clothes and black face paint. However, their plan sadly fails. He wears a dark gray ushanka, a black shirt with matching black gloves and pants. He also wears black facepaint.

Alter Egos From Season Eight[]

Bunraku[]

Bunraku is Kyle's ninja alter ego that appears in "Good Times with Weapons".

He wears this outfit while playing ninjas with the rest of the boys, which consists of an orange vest and wields yellow nunchucks.

Anime Bunraku[]

Anime Bunraku is the anime form of Kyle's alter ego Bunraku which appears in "Good Times with Weapons".

During the anime-styled scenes, Anime Bunraku can be seen in place of its counterpart, which is drawn in the typical South Park art style. His outfit is the same but more detailed, and he, along with the other boys, appear muscular and tall.

Chicken Kyle[]

Chicken Kyle is an alter ego that appears in "Good Times with Weapons".

When fighting against Professor Chaos as ninjas, Cartman tries to use his powers of transformation only to realize that they had been previously taken away by Kyle. After his powers are restored, Cartman turns Kyle into a chicken.

Star Trek Kyle[]

Star Trek Kyle is an alter ego that appears in "The Passion of the Jew".

The boys play shuttlecraft Spontaneity in Cartman's mom's new minivan, with Kyle dressed as a Vulcan. His costume consists of his usual attire with a belt, a toy gun, and fake Vulcan ears.

Wall-Mart Destroyer Kyle[]

Wall-Mart Destroyer Kyle is an alter ego that appears in "Something Wall-Mart This Way Comes".

When the new Wall-Mart opens up in town, the other businesses begin to lose money and have to shut down, causing Kyle, Kenny and Stan to attempt to destroy the superstore while Cartman tries to stop them. Kyle wears a camouflage face paint, a red band around his hat and an ammunition belt.

Pre-school Kyle[]

Pre-school Kyle is an alter ego that appears in "Pre-School".

After Trent Boyett is released from prison, a flashback sequence occurs that takes place in kindergarten explaining why they had gotten him arrested. The boys, pretending to be firefighters, start a fire in the pre-school classroom which ends up being blamed on Trent. Kyle's appearance is similar to his current one, with a similar green Ushanka hat, an orange shirt with a sailboat on the front, and dark green pants. He also wears gray shoes. His jewfro can be seen peeking from his hat and also has buckteeth.

Sexy Action School News Kyle[]

Sexy Action School News Kyle is an alter ego that appears in "Quest for Ratings".

The boys run a school news channel named "Sexy Action School News" which rivals Craig's show, "Animals Close-Up With a Wide-Angle Lens" for ratings. In an attempt to get more viewers, the boys decide to up the production quality, their outfits parodying those of real anchormans. Kyle wears an orange blazer with a badge that says "SSN," a white dress shirt, and a green tie. His hair appears to be styled and straightened.

Antichrist Kyle[]

Antichrist Kyle is an alter ego that appears in "Woodland Critter Christmas".

Cartman writes a Christmas story for class about Satanic Woodland Critters who give birth to the Anti-Christ. In the story, The Woodland Critters need a host who is non-baptized and non-Christian, so they kidnap Kyle to serve this purpose. Once he is freed, he decides he wants to house the Anti-Christ in order to make the world better for Jews, so he allows the demon to possess him. However, once he feels how cold, dark, and evil the Anti-Christ is, he pleads for it to be taken out. Thus, the lion cubs perform an abortion and remove the demon, which Santa promptly smashes with a sledgehammer. He keeps his pants but does not wear a shirt and has glowing red eyes due to him being possessed by the Antichrist.

Alter Egos From Season Nine[]

Basketball Kyle[]

Basketball Kyle is an alter ego that appears in "Mr. Garrison's Fancy New Vagina".

Kyle, who is considered to be the best basketball player in South Park Elementary, decides to try out for the state team but ultimately does not make the cut as he is too short. His team uniform consists a white basketball jersey with an orange lining and "#4" printed on the front, orange basketball shorts, and matching shoes.

Negroplasty Kyle[]

Negroplasty Kyle is an alter ago that appears in "Mr. Garrison's Fancy New Vagina".

After not making the state basketball team, Kyle decides that the only way for him to make the cut is by becoming tall and black like the other players. After learning about Mr. Garrison's sex change, he goes to the plastic surgeon to have a "negroplasty" in order to change his race and height. This results in Kyle becoming tall and black, with several stitch marks where the surgery took place.

Hippie Kyle[]

Hippie Kyle is an alter ego that appears in "Die Hippie, Die".

While selling magazines to support the children of South Park, Kyle, Stan, and Kenny come across a group of hippies who convince them that they are selling themselves out to the corporations. The boys adopt this ideology and become hippies themselves, much to Eric's chagrin. Kyle wears a brown t-shirt with an image of Che Guevara, blue shorts, and sandals.

Whale Heist Kyle[]

Whale Heist Kyle is an alter ego that appears in "Free Willzyx".

After being pranked by a couple of employees at Denver Sea Park, Kyle mistakenly believes he hears the orca Jambu speak to him. The employees, pretending to be Jambu, tell Kyle that his real name is Willzyx and that he lives on the moon. Rallying some of the other South Park boys together, Kyle attempts to return Jambu to his "home" on the moon. During this heist he and the other boys (except Tolkien) wear all black with black face paint.

Karate Kyle[]

Karate Kyle is an alter ego that appears in "Bloody Mary".

Kyle, Ike, Stan, and Cartman are seen taking karate classes in this episode before a drunken Randy embarrasses Stan, kicking off the events of the episode. They all wear traditional white karate uniforms.

Alter Egos From Season Ten[]

Obese Kyle[]

Obese Kyle is an alter ego that appears in "Make Love, Not Warcraft".

After they keep getting killed by a troll while playing World of Warcraft, the boys all decide to dedicate weeks of their life killing wild animals in order to gain experience and level up. They end up spending so much time on the game that they grow obese, with Kyle developing Carpal Tunnel Syndrome and facial acne.

Dawg's Crew Kyle[]

Dawg's Crew Kyle is an alter ego that makes an appearance in "Miss Teacher Bangs a Boy".

Upon discovering that Ike is having an affair with his kindergarten teacher, Ms. Stevenson, Kyle goes to Cartman for help. Cartman, taking his job as Hall Monitor very seriously, agrees to help Kyle. Kyle joins Dawg's Crew, wearing a black t-shirt with "Dawg's" (Cartman's) face on the front over his jacket.

Alter Egos From Season Twelve[]

Elementary School Musical Kyle[]

Elementary School Musical Kyle is an alter ego that makes an appearance in "Elementary School Musical".

Though reluctant at first to join in on the High School Musical fad, the boys decide to sing a musical number in order to regain their reputation. Kyle's outfit remains the same but his hair is styled to mimic Corbin Bleu's hairstyle from the movie.

Britney Spears Kyle[]

Britney Spears Kyle is a disguise worn by Kyle that makes an appearance in "Britney's New Look".

Kyle uses this disguise to distract a crowd of fans while Stan attempts to take Britney Spears to the North Pole to get her away from the press. His disguise consists of a white hat with a pink band, a blonde wig and golden sunglasses.

Peruvian Kyle[]

Peruvian Kyle is an alter ego that appears in the episodes "Pandemic" and "Pandemic 2: The Startling".

After seeing the success of the Peruvian Pan Flute Music bands, the boys come up with the idea to create a band of their own. Kyle wears a Peruvian inspired outfit consisting of a white dress shirt, a patterned vest, and dark blue pants.

Alter Egos From Season Thirteen[]

Bad Economy Kyle[]

Bad Economy Kyle is an alter ego that makes an appearance in "Margaritaville".

When the economy crashes, the residents of South Park decide give up their clothes and start wearing bed sheets to save money. Kyle wears a red sheet meant to be reminiscent of a biblical robe.

Wrestler Kyle[]

Wrestler Kyle is an alter ego that makes an appearance in "W.T.F.".

The boys and some of their classmates decide to sign up for wrestling classes after seeing a World Wrestling Entertainment Raw event. The boys end up deciding the class is "gay" and leave to start wrestling the way they observed on TV. During the class they all wore gray wrestling uniforms and head gear.

Juggernaut[]

Juggernaut is Kyle's wrestling moniker that makes an appearance in "W.T.F.".

After leaving the wrestling classes, the boys begin their own wrestling federation. They all take on different monikers, and Kyle's is called Juggernaut. He wears a fake beard, fake tattoos on his chest and arms, bandages, red shorts and red shoes.

Swimsuit Kyle[]

Swimsuit Kyle is an alter ego that appears in "Pee".

In the episode, Kyle joins his friends on a visit to the water park Pi Pi's Splashtown where he wears green plaid swimming shorts.

Alter Egos From Season Fourteen[]

Program Kyle[]

Program Kyle is an alter ego that appears in "You Have 0 Friends".

He can be seen in the episode with other program versions of South Park characters when Stan becomes trapped inside Facebook after his account develops a mind of its own.

Kyley-B[]

Kyley B is an alter ego that appears in "It's a Jersey Thing".

When the people from New Jersey begin moving into South Park, Kyle notices himself acting strangely. While brushing his teeth one night he begins to involuntarily alter his appearance by shaving and styling his hair and changing his outfit. He later learns that he was conceived in New Jersey, explaining the changes in his behavior. When he is in his Jersey form or shows his Jersey side, he becomes aggressive, violent, irritable, rude and brash. He wears hair gel with the hair in a blowout style and shaped eyebrows, but for attire he has two outfits; the first consists of a black sweatshirt with the sleeves ripped off and a heavy metal-style design he put on himself, blue jeans and bracelets. The second outfit consists of a white shirt with the sleeves rolled up and "Kyley-B" written on the front, gold rings and a gold chain necklace.

Alter Egos From Season Fifteen[]

Airplane Shirt Kyle[]

Airplane Shirt Kyle is an alter ego that makes an appearance in "HUMANCENTiPAD".

After being kidnapped by Steve Jobs, Kyle wakes up in a room without his jacket. He is instead seen wearing a blue shirt with an airplane on the front.

Tooth Decay Kyle[]

Tooth Decay Kyle is an alter ego that makes an appearance in "Royal Pudding".

Mr. Mackey is putting together a play with the kindergarten class about the dangers of tooth decay. Ike, who plays Tooth Decay, ends up leaving to rescue the Canadian princess, leading Mr. Mackey to pressure Kyle into playing the part instead. His costume is hand-made, constructed out of paper cones meant to resemble spikes. The front of the costume reads "Tooth Decay."

CBAA Kyle[]

CBAA Kyle is an alter ego that makes an appearance in "Crack Baby Athletic Association".

After watching a commercial featuring Sarah McLachlan about crack addicted babies, Kyle decides to volunteer at the Colorado Medical Center. He discovers that Cartman is also volunteering with Craig, Clyde, and Butters, who have started a business involving having the babies fight over a small crack rock. Though initially appalled, Kyle is eventually won over by Cartman and joins the Crack Baby Athletic Association. He wears a blue dress shirt, suspenders and a black necktie.

Cartman Burger Kyle[]

Cartman Burger Kyle is an alter ego that makes an appearance in "Ass Burgers".

In the previous episode, "You're Getting Old," Kyle leaves Stan due to the latter's cynicism and starts hanging out with Cartman. When Cartman starts selling hamburgers, Kyle joins him as his employee. His uniform consists of a gray dress shirt and tie under a white apron with "Cartman Burger" written on the front and a matching visor.

Mexican Kyle[]

Mexican Kyle is an alter ego that appears in "The Last of the Meheecans".

The boys play "Texans vs. Mexicans" at a sleepover, with Kyle being on the Mexicans' side. He ends up leading the group after they decide that Butters was not a good enough leader. His costume is made up of a fake moustache, a brown jacket over a striped shirt and a backpack. He is also covered in dirt.

P.E. Kyle[]

P.E. Kyle is an alter ego that appears in "1%".

After South Park Elementary gets the lowest score in the country on the Presidential Fitness Test thanks to Eric Cartman, the entire school is forced to have P.E. instead of recess for four weeks. They all wear the school's gym uniform, which consists of gray sweatpants and a gray T-shirt that reads "South Park Elementary Phys. Ed." on the front.

Tuxedo Kyle[]

Tuxedo Kyle is an alter ego that appears in "A History Channel Thanksgiving".

After he is convinced by Miles Standish and a team of scientists in an attempt to open Natalie Portman's wormhole (which is a portal to Standish's home planet Plymouth), Kyle goes on a "date" with Natalie in order to convinces her to open her own worm hole, which eventually works. His outfit consists of a black tuxedo, with a black bow tie and a white shirt.

The alter ego also appears in the episode of the same season "Funnybot".

Alter Egos From Season Sixteen[]

Moses Kyle[]

Moses Kyle is an alter ego that appears in "Jewpacabra".

Kyle is seen during Cartman's dream sequence taking place Ancient Egypt during the biblical plagues. He speaks to Cartman and explains that the plagues are happening because the Pharaoh of Egypt will not let the Jews go. His ancient attire consists of a red, gold, and black robe, a yellow sash tired around the waist, and a green headband.

Zipline Kyle[]

Zipline Kyle is an alter ego that appears in "I Should Have Never Gone Ziplining".

The boys, realizing that spring break is almost over, decide to go ziplining. Kyle is seen wearing zipline gear with the other boys with a harness and a large yellow helmet.

Thor Kyle[]

Thor Kyle is a Halloween costume worn by Kyle in the episode "A Nightmare on Face Time".

The Boys all decide to do a group costume, dressing as The Avengers for Halloween. Kyle dresses as Thor wearing a blond wig under his hat, gray armor, and a red cape. He also carries around Thor's hammer, Mjölnir.

Alter Egos From Season Seventeen[]

Fart Boy[]

Fart Boy is an alter ego that appears in "Ginger Cow".

Cartman sets up a prank by making a cow look ginger, and only Kyle realizes it is not real. After this prank brought about world peace, Kyle begs Cartman not to tell the truth and becomes his slave in order to keep him from doing so. During a dream, Moses tells him to shave his hair off, and he complies, as well as changing into an oversized white t-shirt and blue shorts.

Alter Egos From Season Eighteen[]

#SaveTheLivingRoom Kyle[]

#SaveTheLivingRoom Kyle is an alter ego that appears in "#HappyHolograms".

Kyle tries to get "#SaveTheLivingRoom" trending in an attempt to bring families back together by watching TV. He wears a white T-shirt with "#SaveTheLivingRoom" printed on the front in black.

Alter Egos From Season Nineteen[]

Hazed Kyle[]

Hazed Kyle is an alter ego that appears in "Stunning and Brave".

When PC Principal and the PC Delta move into town, Kyle makes the mistake of saying he does not believe Caitlyn Jenner is a hero. This leads to him being constantly bullied and hazed by them until he admits that Caitlyn Jenner is stunning and brave. Among other stunts, the PC Delta tied him to a tree, drew penises on his face, and shaved off his hair in certain spots.

SoDoSoPa Ninja Kyle[]

SoDoSoPa Ninja Kyle is an alter ego that appears in "Naughty Ninjas".

After Karen is scared by one of the homeless people taking refuge in SoDoSoPa, Kenny decides to create a band of SoDoSoPa Ninjas in order to scare people away. The boys, predominantly Cartman, think that they are being "gay" until they see how the ninjas scared away a couple. Though the townspeople were frightened because they thought they were members of ISIS, the boys believe that the town is just scared of ninjas. Kyle wears all black with a brown backpack and toolbelt. Cartman frequently confuses him for other ninjas.

Alter Egos From Season Twenty-One[]

Rabbit Kyle[]

Rabbit Kyle is a disguise worn by Kyle that makes an appearance in "Holiday Special".

After Columbus Day is cancelled, the boys decide to take matters into their own hands so they can get the day off. They disguise themselves with animal masks and kidnap Peter Galtman in order to show him a VHS tape of Randy kicking a Native American. Kyle's mask is an uncannily realistic white rabbit mask.

Barbershop Quartet Kyle[]

Barbershop Quartet Kyle is an alter ego that makes an appearance in "Hummels & Heroin".

Stan decides to steal Ms. McGillicutty's hummels in order to make Marvin Marsh the "top bitch" at Shady Acres. The boys create a distraction by dressing up as a barbershop quartet and singing for the senior citizens. They all wear matching outfits in different colors, and Kyle's consists of a white button up shirt, a purple and white vertical striped vest, a white hat with a dark purple band, and a black bow tie.

Changed Kyle[]

Changed Kyle is an alter ego that makes an appearance in "SUPER HARD PCness".

After being dumped by Heidi Turner and made fun of by her and Cartman, Kyle decides to change his appearance. He shaves his hair shorter and changes into a blue polo shirt. He looks pleased by this change, though he covers it up with his hat and jacket anyway.

Millennials Against Canada Kyle[]

Millennials Against Canada Kyle is an alter ego that makes an appearance in "SUPER HARD PCness".

After being bullied by Cartman and Heidi, Kyle decides that the new Terrance and Phillip show is not funny anymore and believes it promotes bullying and meanness. He starts up a group called Millennials Against Canada, abbreviated to M.A.C., hoping his movement will put a stop to all the negativity in the world. He wears a white t-shirt with a red text that reads "M.A.C." on the front and a whistle tied around his neck.

Alter Egos From Season Twenty-Two[]

Poo-Stained Kyle[]

Poo-Stained Kyle is an alter ego that appears in "The Problem with a Poo".

Mr. Hankey, after getting high on Ambien, starts making offensive tweets about the citizens of South Park, putting himself in jeopardy of being fired from his job as director of the Christmas pageant. Kyle becomes Mr. Hankey's lawyer; however, Hankey ends up ruining things by tweeting more offensive things. This culminates in a fight between Kyle and Mr. Hankey, during which Kyle becomes covered in feces. In the end, he gives up on helping Mr. Hankey.

Sledgehammer Kyle[]

Sledgehammer Kyle is a Halloween costume worn by Kyle in "The Scoots".

Kyle wears a costume of the character Sledgehammer from Fortnite: Battle Royale. He wears this costume when out trick-or-treating using scooters to get more candy. It consists of a fake red beard, a tan vest over his usual jacket and tan pants.

Ritual Kyle[]

Ritual Kyle is an alter ego that appears in "Time To Get Cereal".

After ManBearPig starts causing destruction in South Park, the boys seek help from Al Gore, who informs them that ManBearPig is actually a demon. They all perform a ritual summoning Satan to defeat ManBearPig. Kyle wears a black robe and holds a candle.

Nobel Peace Prize Kyle[]

Nobel Peace Prize Kyle is an alter ego that appears in "Time To Get Cereal".

When the police show up to arrest the boys for allegedly taking part in a school shooting, Al Gore urges them to convince the police of ManBearPig's existence. Kyle is given Al Gore's Nobel Peace Prize before leaving to give himself up to the police along with the other boys.

Alter Egos From Season Twenty-Three[]

Rabbi Kyle[]

Rabbi Kyle is an alter ego that appears in "Mexican Joker".

When Kyle and Cartman are sent to an ICE Detention Center, Kyle comes up with a plan to set all the children free by convincing the guards that he had converted them all to Judaism. He dresses as a rabbi, making a yarmulke out of tin foil and wearing a towel wrapped around his shoulders.

Blue Eyed Kyle[]

Blue Eyed Kyle is an alter ego that appears in "Turd Burglars".

Kyle's mother gets a fecal transplant, which causes her friends to envy her after they see the impact it had on her health. After talking to a doctor about people swapping microbiomes and learns that Tom Brady's poo is the cure. The rest of the boys go to Tom Brady's house to obtain his feces, only to be interrupted by Kyle, whose body had been taken over by microorganisms, causing his eyes to glow blue. He finds Tom Brady's stash of poo and they all bring it to the doctor to allow everyone to be cured.

Alter Egos From Season Twenty-Four[]

Masked Kyle[]

Masked Kyle is an alter ego that makes an appearance in "The Pandemic Special".

Due to COVID-19, everyone in town has to wear masks when leaving the house. When school starts back again, Kyle is seen in the classroom wearing a dark gray mask along with the other children. He also wears this mask throughout "South ParQ Vaccination Special" when outside his house.

Kommunity Kidz Kyle[]

Kommunity Kidz Kyle is an alter ego that makes an appearance in "South ParQ Vaccination Special".

After Cartman and Kenny pull a prank on Mrs. Nelson, making it appear as though she got her period in class, she ends up quitting. Mr. Garrison returns to teach in her place, leading the boys to try and get their former teacher back. Mr. Mackey informs them that the only way she would return to the school is if they are able to get her vaccinated, so they devise a plan to get into Walgreens to steal the vaccines. They disguise themselves as Kommunity Kidz, a nonprofit organization to help senior citizens get vaccinated. Their plan succeeds, allowing them to steal enough vaccinations to get all the teachers immunized. Kyle wears dark blue medical scrubs, a dark gray mask, and a hospital sign taped to his hat.

Alter Egos From Season Twenty-Five[]

Airsoft Kyle[]

Airsoft Kyle is an alter ego that makes an appearance in "Help, My Teenager Hates Me!".

This costume consists of goggles, a kevlar vest and an Airsoft rifle. Kyle becomes interested in playing Airsoft with the other boys and pleads to his father to help him buy some armor and weapons.

South Park: Phone Destroyer[]

Gunslinger Kyle[]

Main article: Gunslinger Kyle

Gunslinger Kyle is a playable card in South Park: Phone Destroyer.

He is a 3-cost Common Ranged card of the Adventure theme. His outfit consists of an oversized brown jacket, a belt wrapped around his hat with a bull belt buckle, a green bandana scarf, a black gun holster and a brown belt with a golden buckle. When he uses his Charge skill, he will give all allies a large Attack buff for 5 seconds.

Bounty Hunter Kyle[]

Main article: Bounty Hunter Kyle

Bounty Hunter Kyle is a playable card in South Park: Phone Destroyer.

This card is a 3-Cost Epic Ranged unit of the Sci-Fi theme. He wears a large black welder mask, yellow shoulder pads and a brown cape and his in-game sprite shows that his jetpack is made out of two leaf-blowers. His outfit is largely based on the character Boba Fett from Star Wars. He is a flyer. Whenever he attacks an opponent, he will buff the Attack stat of all allies and heals all allies if he kills an opponent.

The Master Ninjew[]

Main article: The Master Ninjew

The Master Ninjew is a playable card and a boss in the campaign of South Park: Phone Destroyer.

He is a 4-Cost Legendary Ranged unit of the Mystical theme. He wears a black mask with a white rim, a black robe, a white scarf draped around his neck and weapons carried on his back along with a scroll. On the card artwork he also has a white belt. The name "The Master Ninjew" mainly pokes fun at how Kyle is dressed up as a ninja and poking fun at how he is Jewish. When summoned, he will give a permanent attack buff to all allies.
